H0.text: Some base sequences code for protein production, which is why the particular sequence of bases in a segment of DNA is important to cells.

H1.text: Some base sequences cause the release of lipids from the nucleus, which is why the particular sequence of bases in a segment of DNA is important to cells.

H2.text: Some base sequences contain the order of sugars in polysaccharides, which explains why the particular sequence of bases in a segment of DNA is important to cells.

H3.text: Some base sequences produce electrical signals sent to the cytoplasm, which is why the particular sequence of bases in a segment of DNA is important to cells.

A4.text: RNA strands specify the sequence of amino acids within proteins in a process called translation.
